item.title: Reading Highlights
item.description: A list of the 42 Articles I’ve read so far Some Stats Period Amount Read April 2022 42 Articles Life is Short Why I got a PhD at age 61 When your manager isn’t supporting you, build a Voltron Notes on Work Michelle Bu - Payments Products Tech Lead at Stripe From The Desk Of A Trader #2 Code rewrites and joint cognitive systems A Tale of Yak Shaving- Accidentally Making a Language, for an Engine, for a Game The True Sources of DeFi Yield Why Maple Finance’s Milkshakes Will Bring All Building data-centric apps with a reactive relational database Don’t Write Just in Plain Text How Women-and Their Hair-Transformed South Korea The Huge Endeavor to Produce a Tiny Microchip 3-2-1- Handling challenges, living authentically, and giving value Farewell, Big Data How Philosophers Think Two vexing problems in functional programming A beginner’s guide to social tokens Are we running out of resources- The Classpath is a Lie Michael Plant - University of Oxford A beginner’s guide to DeFi Is Web3 a Solution Seeking a Problem- The Career Success Guide There’s never been such a severe shortage of homes in the U.

item.title: Technical Things
item.description: I’m currenltly pre-occupied with learning about Typescript Trading Bots Testing With Cypress Web3

item.title: Testing With Cypress
item.description: Introduction Cypress allows you to automate the testing of your code. The goal of using a tool like Cypress is to be able to refactor with confidence.

item.title: Trading Bots
item.description: Introduction Notes from my lil foray into automated money making~ A smart contract is a program that runs on the Ethereum blockchain.

item.title: Typescipt
item.description: Overview Typescript is an open source, typed syntactic superset of Javascript. It compiles to readable JS Using typescript, we can write better programs which are easier to edit and refactor down the line.

item.title: What Im Reading
item.description: Here’s a quick collection of articles I liked and read recently. Books will be separately filed at some point
